    Since:

      • getVisualComponent

        public JComponent getVisualComponent()
        Get component that will be shown in the Search Results window. Is should be created lazily.

      • addMatchingObject

        public void addMatchingObject(U object)
        This method is called when a new matching object is found. It should add representation of this matching object to model of created visual component.
        Specified by:
        addMatchingObject in class SearchResultsDisplayer<U>

      • getTitle

        public String getTitle()
        Return title of this displayer. It will be displayed in the tab within search results window.
        Specified by:
        getTitle in class SearchResultsDisplayer<U>

      • searchStarted

        public void searchStarted()
        Called right after the search was started. Default implementation does nothing.
        Overrides:

      • searchFinished

        public void searchFinished()
        Called right after the search was finished. Default implementation does nothing.

      • getOutlineView

        @NonNull
public OutlineView getOutlineView()
        Get outline view. You can alter it to display additional node properties, or set custom cell renderer.
        Returns:
        OutlineView used in the results displayer.

      • setInfoNode

        public void setInfoNode(Node infoNode)
        Set node that display information from the search listener. This method is called right after a new displayer is created, before method SearchResultsDisplayer.getVisualComponent(). The default implementation does nothing. Override it if you want to add the info node to your UI.
        Overrides:
        setInfoNode in class SearchResultsDisplayer<U>

      • setResultNodeShiftSupport

        public void setResultNodeShiftSupport(DefaultSearchResultsDisplayer.ResultNodeShiftSupport resultNodeShiftSupport)
        Set a custom DefaultSearchResultsDisplayer.ResultNodeShiftSupport for this displayer.

      • addButton

        public void addButton(@NonNull
                      AbstractButton button)
        Add a button to the results displayer toolbar. It will be shown right above the stop button.
        Parameters:
        button - Button to add.
